history.content: The freezing period you speak of is typically 6 months, you should be fine for next year.

children.subject:
I don't know specifics about every individual company, but I've never heard of the one year thing being a barrier to anyone getting a job for the same situation that you're in. There are thousands of students at Berkeley in the exact same boat as you, and it wouldn't make sense for companies like Google and Facebook to invalidate students for literally one year, effectively eliminating tons of great students for a terrible reason. If anything "next year" just implies applying during this same recruiting season next year. I don't think they're literally counting the days until they can accept your application.

Trust me, the increased chances of getting these internships this year (plus all the interview experience you'd be getting) far far outweighs any chance that these companies don't let you reapply next year, which I believe is not the case anyways.

OP here:)

Thank you for the reply, Sherman!

But I heard that Facebook and Google have one year frozen period, but Google's internship frozen period won't affect full-time new grad job hunting, while Facebook's will.

So I am wondering whether I should try these companies now..

Thank you again!

history.content:
Hi, all! 

I am currently a rising sophomore and I am worried about whether I should apply for "big" companies as soon as possible. I heard that if we fail the interviews for google, amazon, facebook, linkedin, etc., then we have to wait for one year until we can apply again, counting from the date of interview. But in this case, I am worried that if I am not prepared well enough, then I may ruin the chance for going into these companies not only this year, but also next year, since after the freezing period, it is already late into the recruiting season.

Does anyone have relevant experiences about this situation? 

Thank you all for any help!
history.subject: Worried about freezing period in job searching?

Does anyone have relevant experiences about this situation? 

Thank you all for any help!

I am really sorry if I raised any anxiety... It's just sometimes the more I think about the future (job recruiting), the more I feel anxious and panic...
